DOC.detailed_description: In adolescent , anorexia nervosa severely affect physical , emotional , social development . Despite seriousness prevalence adolescent anorexia nervosa , study focus effectiveness various type psychotherapy treatment . Family-based therapy may effective approach treat adolescent anorexia nervosa . This study compare effectiveness family-based therapy versus ego-oriented individual psychotherapy treatment adolescent anorexia nervosa . Simultaneously , examine potential predictor , mediator , moderator weight gain , psychological concern weight shape , change family functioning . Participants open-label study randomly assign receive one two type therapy : family-based therapy ego-oriented individual psychotherapy . Both type therapy give total 24 hour course 12 month . Physical psychological assessment complete study visit baseline , immediately post-treatment , six month post-treatment , one year post-treatment . Amount weight gain evaluate , along change weight body shape concern , measure Eating Disorder Examination .
